ygData.subject: Re: Problem running from command line
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Figured it out...put the user password string into the heritrix properties file (in the conf dir) and the just run it like this:

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "tgeorgio"
<tristen_georgiou@...> w=
rote:
>
> Hi all,
> 
> I've run crawls successfully through the web UI fine=
, but when I try
> to run an order from the command line, I can't get it to=
 work. I
> copied the order and the seeds file from a crawl that ran fine i=
n the
> UI, and modified the seeds file, crawl name, and other order params=
.
> 
> I then try to run the crawl from the command line like this:
> 
> $H=
ERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix --nowui --admin=3Dadmin:letmein order.xml
> 
> Th=
e result is the help screen dump and no error...is there a crucial
> step o=
r argument I am missing or have incorrect?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Tristen
>

Fig=
ured it out...put the user password string into the heritrix
properties fil=
e (in the conf dir) and the just run it like this:

$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heri=
trix --nowui order.xml
